entries.meaning: A contest, in a cockpit, between gamecocks fitted with cockspurs

verbs.description: cockfight (third-person singular simple present cockfights, present participle cockfighting, simple past and past participle cockfought)

entries.meaning: To participate in (as a rooster), or organize and run (as a gambler or bookmaker), a cockfighting event.
examples: I watched through to the triumphant ending, in which Chicken George cockfought his way to freedom and came back with gold to buy his family out of postwar sharecropping.
